meanings.sent1: The rankest smell filled the room, making everyone cover their noses.
meanings.sent2: The rankest chili I ever tasted was so spicy, it made me cry.
meanings.sent3: The rankest roller coaster in the amusement park was so thrilling, it left everyone screaming with joy.
meanings.sent4: The rankest competition brought out the best in all the participants, pushing them to their limits.
meanings.sent5: The rankest storm we had ever seen left a trail of destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: Having a strong or offensive smell
meanings.sent1: The rankest cheese in the fridge made the whole kitchen smell terrible.
meanings.sent2: After a long hike, his socks had the rankest odor imaginable.
meanings.sent3: The rankest garbage bin in the neighborhood attracted all the stray cats.
meanings.sent4: The rankest perfume she wore was so overpowering, it made people sneeze.
meanings.sent5: The rankest skunk sprayed near our house, and the smell lingered for days.

meanings.definition: Growing or spreading vigorously and aggressively
meanings.sent1: The rankest vines in the garden climbed up the walls faster than any other plant.
meanings.sent2: The rankest weeds in the field choked out all the other flowers.
meanings.sent3: The rankest rumor in school spread like wildfire among the students.
meanings.sent4: The rankest ivy on the old building gave it a mysterious and overgrown look.
meanings.sent5: The rankest forest in the region was so dense, sunlight barely reached the ground.
